intro: Axyris pamirica, commonly known as the Pamir spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, milky sap and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its stems are erect and branching. Axyris pamirica is adapted to cold climates and is often found in the Pamir and Tien Shan mountain ranges.
